column4: type ls before you run the command so you can copy it from the filename
copy the name of the files exactly when you type the command in
he really need to install from the binary?
why not the packages, automatix, or the restricted modules dealie/
i don't even use the ubuntu binary, i use the one from nvidia.com
aside from automatix, the other two are one and the same....unless youre installing from nvidia's .run you have to have the restricted driver's package.  he has both.
er, not one and the same, but linked
something got really effed up somewhere, and he says it's a fresh install.  my only other advice would be to format and try again.
just was curious why have a newb install outside the package manager... if there was a real reason.
because there isn't anything difficult about typing sudo apt-get install packagename
if they've managed to get ubuntu installed they can do that
i was talking about having him run nv*run.
because the repo binaries weren't working.  and i wasn't having him run it i was having him extract files from it
it's not automatix that breaks the machines it's how it installs the apps.
